00034     double Transform::frameLogEnergy(const Frame* frame)
00035     {
00036         double energy = std::accumulate(frame->begin(), frame->end(),
00037                 0.0, SquareAndSum());
00038 
00039         return (energy > 0) ? std::log10(energy) : 0.0;
00040     }

00050     double Transform::framePower(const Frame* frame)
00051     {
00052         double energy = std::accumulate(frame->begin(), frame->end(),
00053                 0.0, SquareAndSum());
00054 
00055         return energy / frame->getLength();
00056     }

00072     double Transform::fft(const std::vector<double>& data,
00073             spectrumType& spectrum)
00074     {
00075         // input signal size
00076         unsigned int N = data.size();
00077 
00078         // bit-reversing the samples - a requirement of radix-2
00079         // instead of reversing in place, put the samples to result vector
00080         unsigned int a = 1, b = 0, c = 0;
00081         for (b = 1; b < N; ++b)
00082         {
00083             if (b < a)
00084             {
00085                 spectrum[a - 1] = data[b - 1];
00086                 spectrum[b - 1] = data[a - 1];
00087             }
00088             c = N / 2;
00089             while (c < a)
00090             {
00091                 a -= c;
00092                 c /= 2;
00093             }
00094             a += c;
00095         }
00096 
00097         // FFT calculation using "butterflies"
00098         // code ported from Matlab, based on book by Tomasz P. Zieli≈Ñski
00099 
00100         // FFT stages count
00101         unsigned int numStages = static_cast<unsigned int>(
00102                 std::log(double(N)) / LN_2);
00103 
00104         // L = 2^k - DFT block length and offset
00105         // M = 2^(k-1) - butterflies per block, butterfly width
00106         // p - butterfly index
00107         // q - block index
00108         // r - index of sample in butterfly
00109         // Wi - starting value of Fourier base coefficient
00110         // W - Fourier base multiplying factor
00111         unsigned int L = 0, M = 0, p = 0, q = 0, r = 0;
00112         cplx W(0, 0), Wi(0, 0), Temp(0, 0);
00113 
00114         // iterate over the stages
00115         for (unsigned int k = 1; k <= numStages; ++k)
00116         {
00117             L = 1 << k;
00118             M = 1 << (k - 1);
00119             Wi = cplx(1);
00120             W = exp((-j) * 2.0 * M_PI / double(L));
00121 
00122             // iterate over butterflies
00123             for (p = 1; p <= M; ++p)
00124             {
00125                 // iterate over blocks
00126                 for (q = p; q <= N; q += L)
00127                 {
00128                     r = q + M;
00129                     Temp = spectrum[r - 1] * Wi;
00130                     spectrum[r - 1] = spectrum[q - 1] - Temp;
00131                     spectrum[q - 1] = spectrum[q - 1] + Temp;
00132                 }
00133                 Wi *= W;
00134             }
00135         }
00136 
00137         double maxAbs = 0.0, currAbs = 0.0;
00138         unsigned int N2 = N >> 1; // N/2
00139 
00140         // scaling by N/2 and searching for maximum magnitude
00141         // we can iterate only over the first half of the spectrum,
00142         // because of the symmetry, yet scaling is applied
00143         // to both halves
00144         for (unsigned int k = 0; k < N2; ++k)
00145         {
00146             spectrum[k] /= N2;
00147             spectrum[N2 + k] /= N2;
00148             currAbs = std::abs(spectrum[k]);
00149             if ((currAbs > maxAbs))
00150                 maxAbs = currAbs;
00151         }
00152 
00153         return maxAbs;
00154     }

00171     double Transform::fft(const Frame* frame, spectrumType& spectrum)
00172     {
00173         // the vector is initialized to zero padded length,
00174         // what means that it contains default values of contained type
00175         // (0.0 in case of double); that allows us to loop
00176         // only to frame length without padding and
00177         // automatically have zeros at the end of data
00178         std::vector<double> data(zeroPaddedLength);
00179         unsigned int length = frame->getLength();
00180         Frame::iterator it = frame->begin(), end = frame->end();
00181 
00182         // first sample does not need preemphasis
00183         data[0] = *it;
00184         ++it;
00185         double current = 0.0, previous = data[0];
00186 
00187         // iterate over all samples of the frame
00188         // filter the data through preemphasis
00189         // and apply a chosen window function
00190         for (unsigned int n = 1; it != end; ++it, ++n)
00191         {
00192             current = *it;
00193             data[n] = (current - preemphasisFactor * previous) *
00194                     Window::apply(winType, n, length);
00195             previous = current;
00196         }
00197 
00198         return fft(data, spectrum);
00199     }

00209     void Transform::dct(const std::vector<double>& data,
00210             std::vector<double>& output)
00211     {
00212         using namespace std;
00213 
00214         // output size determines how many coefficients will be calculated
00215         unsigned int outputLength = output.size();
00216         unsigned int inputLength = data.size();
00217 
00218         // DCT scaling factor
00219         double c0 = sqrt(1.0 / inputLength);
00220         double cn = sqrt(2.0 / inputLength);
00221         // cached cosine values
00222         double** cosines = getCachedCosines(inputLength, outputLength);
00223 
00224         for (unsigned int n = 0; n < outputLength; ++n)
00225         {
00226             output[n] = 0.0;
00227             for (unsigned int k = 0; k < inputLength; ++k)
00228             {
00229                 // 1e-10 added for the logarithm value to be grater than 0
00230                 output[n] += log(fabs(data[k]) + 1e-10) * cosines[n][k];
00231             }
00232 
00233             output[n] *= (0 == n) ? c0 : cn;
00234         }
00235     }
00236 
00246     double** Transform::getCachedCosines(unsigned int inputLength, unsigned int outputLength)
00247     {
00248         cosineCacheKeyType key = std::make_pair(inputLength, outputLength);
00249 
00250         // if we have that key cached, return immediately!
00251         if (cosineCache.find(key) != cosineCache.end())
00252         {
00253             return cosineCache[key];
00254         }
00255 
00256         // nothing in cache for that pair, calculate cosines
00257         double** cosines = new double*[outputLength];
00258         for (unsigned int n = 0; n < outputLength; ++n)
00259         {
00260             cosines[n] = new double[inputLength];
00261 
00262             for (unsigned int k = 0; k < inputLength; ++k)
00263             {
00264                 // from the definition of DCT
00265                 cosines[n][k] = cos((M_PI * (2*k+1) * n) /
00266                                     (2 * inputLength));
00267             }
00268         }
00269 
00270         // store in cache and return
00271         cosineCache[key] = cosines;
00272 
00273         return cosines;
00274     }
00275 
00279     void Transform::clearCache()
00280     {
00281         cosineCacheType::const_iterator it;
00282         for (it = cosineCache.begin(); it != cosineCache.end(); it++)
00283         {
00284             cosineCacheKeyType key = it->first;
00285             double** cosines = it->second;
00286             unsigned int outputLength = key.second;
00287             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < outputLength; ++i)
00288             {
00289                 delete cosines[i];
00290             }
00291             delete cosines;
00292         }
00293     }
